value.name: Colombia's Duque Says He’s Deploying Military to Protest-hit Cali
value.description: Colombian President Ivan Duque announced Friday he was deploying military troops to Cali, at the epicenter of bloody anti-government protests across the country that have left dozens dead over the past month.

value.name: 'No impunity' for Colombia police abuses, national director says
value.description: "They must respond before the authorities and whoever has knowingly committed a crime; the response will have the full weight of the law," national police director General Jorge Luis Vargas told ...

value.name: Vargas repeats as SAC Player of Year
value.description: Luis Vargas repeated as Player of the Year, and six Wayland Baptist Pioneers were recognized when the All-SAC Baseball Team was announced today. Vargas, a junior outfielder and the NAIA home runs leader for the second straight year,

value.name: No impunity for police officers responsible for abuse says Colombia's top cop
value.description: The head of Colombia's National Police Force General Jorge Luis Vargas has said that officers who are responsible for abuses or acts of violence amid ongoing protests will be punished to the full extent of the law.

video.name: No impunity for police officers responsible for abuse says Colombia's top cop

value.name: The anger driving Colombia's protest movement isn't going away anytime soon
value.description: What started as a tax reform proposal to help ease the strain of the pandemic on the economy and balance government finances ended with people taking to the streets to express their discontent.

value.name: The popular uprising is bringing down the neoliberal and militarist regime
value.description: In Popayán, the militaristic response to the uprising of popular indignation caused by police abuses has already cost one student dead, missing and injured. Something similar has happened in Yumbo. These military “theatres of operations” were authorized personally and directly by President Iván Duque,

value.name: Colombia Under Pressure to Halt Police Violence Against Protesters
value.description: In an interview, Gen. Jorge Luis Vargas, commander of Colombia’s National Police, acknowledged unlawful acts of violence by what he called a minority of officers. He said 130 cases of alleged ...

value.name: Colombia Strikes Clan del Golfo Structures
value.description: The military siege against leaders of criminal groups in Colombia continues to show positive results. Structures of the Clan del Golfo have suffered major blows. On March 24, 2021, Colombian Minister of Defense Diego Molano announced simultaneous operations that led to the capture of 25 Clan del Golfo members in Chocó department.
